snippet: Less than a month before the start of insurance shopping under the health care law, former President Bill Clinton’s speech comes at a pivotal time for the Obama administration.
abstract: Former Pres Bill Clinton, during speech in Little Rock, Ark, makes case for Americans of all political leanings to embrace Obama health care reform law; speech comes less than a month before Americans can start shopping for insurance under the law.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: Robert Pear and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Less than a month before the start of insurance shopping under the health care law, former President Bill Clinton’s speech comes at a pivotal time for the Obama administration.

headline.main: Clinton Urges Americans to Sign Up for Health Care Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Clinton Urges Americans to Sign Up for Health Care Exchanges

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
